data.title: Jim Hall and Red Mitchell high res disc, etc
data.meta_description:

data.text:
I saw a review of a Jim Hall / Red Mitchell recording in 'Jazz Junction' magazine. Title is "Valse Hot - Sweet Basil, 1978"

What caught my attention was a mention that as well as an Audio CD you got a disc of '96k/24' files. So I decided to buy a copy out of curiosity.

What I got was, indeed, two discs. One an Audio CD the other a data disc. The files are in fact 192k/24. So the review was incorrect. Curiously, the sleeve and printing on the disc are *also* wrong.

The sleeve says "28BIT 96K" which is clearly weird.

The disc has "24 Bit / 96k" on it, which is plausible, but wrong.

The disc seems to be produced by 'Artistshare' a crowdfunded setup. But the info I found on the web about this seems muddled.

Anyone know of other labels/examples of a recording like this which gives you a disc of high res files? Something I wish more companies would do.
